definition: behind/at the back/in the rear/behind sb's back
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: At the edge of the forest, behind the dunes, I set up my small tarp.
sentences.chinese: 在边缘的森林，背后的沙丘，我设立了我的小篷布。

sentences.english: He was mugged from behind and forced into a dark room.
sentences.chinese: 他从背后被勒住脖子，被迫进入一间黑屋。

sentences.english: Thekeydriver behind the increase will come from basic set-top boxes.
sentences.chinese: 增长背后的主要驱动力来自于基础机顶盒市场。

sentences.english: But he said that more investigations were needed into its causes.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他说，其背后的原因还需要更多的研究。

sentences.english: Miniature wooden house on pond, traditional house in background, Aland Islands.
sentences.chinese: 奥兰群岛，池塘中的模型木屋以及背后的传统房屋。

sentences.english: Ay, I don't talk behind a nigga back, I say it in his face.
sentences.chinese: 诶，我不会在人背后说三道四，我会当着他的面说。

sentences.english: and you may have even guessed that it's the real face behind Design, LLC.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可能猜到设计有限责任公司背后的真面目。

sentences.english: Behind any great innovation, there's an irritant.
sentences.chinese: 在所有伟大的创新背后都有某个刺激性的东西。

sentences.english: It is not nice to talk behind other people's back.
sentences.chinese: 在别人背后说坏话是不好的。

sentences.english: The background is the Singapore International School in WCH.
sentences.chinese: 背后是黄竹坑的新加坡国际学校。

sentences.english: I noticed, behind the neutrality of his gaze, a deep weariness.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到他不露声色的注视背后藏着深深的厌倦。
但是背后的过程实际上非比寻常。

sentences.english: Where dost thou stand behind them all, my lover, hiding thyself in the shadows?
sentences.chinese: 我的情人，你站在大家背后，藏在何处的阴影中呢？

sentences.english: The idea behind the Template layer is that the presentation layer code is separate from the business-layer code.
sentences.chinese: 模板层背后的思想就是表示层代码与业务层代码分离。

sentences.english: Then place one wrap behind the wings and around the hook shank.
sentences.chinese: 然后把背后的翅膀一裹，前后小腿钩。

definition: of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
in fact/in reality/as a matter of fact/in practice
in fact/in reality/actually/as a matter of fact/de facto/ipso facto
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
to go to the bottom of a matter/after all/when all is said and done/(in an interrogative sentence) finally/outcome/result
